title.narrative: Durable Solutions Somalia 2017-2020 + covid-19 funds

description.narrative: Durable solutions in Mogadishu, Dollow, Kismayo and Baidoa following the displacement crisis in Somalia. Additional grant of DKK 20,000,000 covid-19 funds.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Output 4.2 The relevant Govt departments are ensuring positive national policy and practice towards returnees and IDPs inconformity to international regional requirements e.g. IGAD National Plan of Action and the CRRF
Number of actions/steps taken by the Somali national government towards implementation of a policy for durable solutions for IDPs or returnees
Output 1.4: Advocacy on IDP and returnee land tenure referrals and capacity to address land disputes are strengthened

Output 3.2: Returnees and IDPs have improved business skills, apprenticeships, savings and loans and opportunities for employment
Number of IDPs and returnees with access to financial services
Output 2.1: Access to adequate and permanent housing in Displaced Affected Communities improved
No. of households able to demonstrate that they have adequate housing
